testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Laptop1 connect to lan port eth1 Laptop2 connect to lan port eth4 BR connect to switch
Test Procedure:
1. Lan ports eth1/eth4 work with bridge-access mode 2. Configure native-vlan for eth1/eth4 mapped from mgt0 native-vlan, such as native-vlan 10 CLI: Interface mgt0 native-vlan 10 3. Show lan port-config, check default vlan for eth1/eth4 Result1 4. Confingure native-vlan for eth1/eth4 mapped from eth1/eth4 native-vlan, such as native- vlan is 1 CLI: Interface eth1 native-vlan 1 Interface eth4 native-vlan 1 5. Show lan port-config, check default vlan for eth1/eth4 Result2 6. Laptop1 ping laptop2 Result3 7. Configure native-vlan for eth1/eth4 mapped from mgt0 native-vlan, such as native-vlan 20 CLI: Interface mgt0 native-vlan 20
8. Show lan port-config, check default vlan for eth1/eth4 Result4 9. 10. Laptop1 ping laptop2 Result5

step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: 1. Lan ports eth1/eth2 work with bridge-access mode
step.telnet: -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access" -v "interface eth2 mode bridge-access"

step.desc: 2. Configure mgt0 native-vlan, such as native-vlan 10
3. Show lan port-config, check default vlan for eth1/eth2: the default vlan for eth1/eth2 is 1
4. Confingure native-vlan for eth1/eth2 mapped from user-profile attribute.
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "user-profile lan2 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute 2" -v "interface eth2 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 2" -v "interface mgt0 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.desc: 5. Show lan port-config, check default vlan for eth1/eth2
vpc1 connect to lan port eth1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
vpc2 connect to lan port eth1
set br1.vpc2.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
6. vpc1 ping vpc2: vpc1 ping vpc2 successfully
